meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into vapor.
meanings.sent1: The sun's heat can vaporize water into steam.
meanings.sent2: I watched the ice cube vaporize into thin air.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could vaporize a glass of water in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The morning mist seemed to vaporize as the sun rose higher in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The hot tea made the frost on the window vaporize instantly.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind can vaporize the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick was to vaporize a coin in front of the audience.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could vaporize my homework when I don't feel like doing it.
meanings.sent4: The detective's keen observation skills seemed to vaporize any doubts about the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news seemed to vaporize all the excitement in the room.
